creditline: Gift of Ruth Lathrop Sikes in memory of her brother Bruce Sikes, 1967
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
provenance: Frank Loyd Wright; Van Vleck; Metzgar
text: This series of popular courtesans is a mitate (visual parody) on the classical Chinese set of 'Eight Views of the Xiaoxiang Rivers'. The courtesan Segawa and her attendant are playing shamisen while returning boats can be seen in the back. Like many of Koryūsai's prints, it is accompanied by a thirty-one-syllable poem.
title: The Courtesan Segawa of the Matsubaya: Returning Sails
